result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler A Bostwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: probationary periods are to be concurrent

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $1, 489.76 to the City of Lake Mills (joint and several with Codell Miller)
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--to undergo assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--to have no presence in bars or taverns
--monthly testing for illegal drug use
--continue and complete ongoing treatment with Family Resource Associates, Inc.

Arresting Agency: LMPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler A Bostwick

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 15CM94 and 15CM152 called together at 3:09pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Tyler A Bostwick in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber submits a Victim Impact and Restitution Statement

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Case 15CM94 Count #1 and Case 15CM152 Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: all remaining counts of both cases.


ADA Teuber orally motions for the Court to change in the Criminal Complaint of case 15CM94 the Dane Co. case number listed, the Court grants

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Atty. Zarwell requests that Mr. Bostwick once all conditions of Probation are met and as statutory allowable be Terminated from Probation

On Case 15CM94 Count #1 and on Case 15CM152 Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, probationary periods are to be concurrent with conditions:

--to undergo assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--to have no presence in bars or taverns
--monthly testing for illegal drug use
--continue and complete ongoing treatment with Family Resource Associates, Inc.
--to pay restitution in the amount of $1, 489.76 to the City of Lake Mills (joint and several with Codell Miller)
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--On Case 15CM94, Count #1 to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--On Case 15CM152, Count #1 to pay costs of $243plus the $200 DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served:  0  days

The Court directs Mr. Bostwick to report to the Probation office today, if they are closed for the day then Mr. Bostwick is to report on Monday.
recess: 3:37pm

Cases 15CM94 & 15CM152 called together at 1:50 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding in BrIV]
Defendant Tyler A Bostwick in court with Attorney David Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zarwell requests that matters be set out a few weeks, presents basis including recently received discovery & need to determine restitution
ADA Hall: No objection
Recess: 1:53 pm 

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 7/31/15 at 3:00 pm - Send notices
Status conference on July 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Cases 15CM94 & 15CM152 called together at 10:28 am 
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Tyler A Bostwick in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. (Atty Witt only on 15CM94) ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CM94 - Atty Witt: Had resolution of matter, but do believe with new case, should be able have joint offer. Do have conflict on 15CM152, so will be asking to withdraw as counsel on this matter.
ADA Teuber: No objection
Court grants motion to withdraw

15CM152: Service of Complaint admitted; penalties recited; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered on Defendant's behalf; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with Codell "Cody" Miller
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence at Wallace Park, Lake Mills
Recess: 10:36 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 6/14/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/10/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
